name: MazeBot (itch)
description:
MazeBot is a simple maze solving program written in Sinclair BASIC for the ZX Spectrum. 

The built in maze editor allows you to draw a fixed size maze, which the computer will attempt to solve using a 'breadcrumbs' approach. It's slow and not terribly efficient, but it's a fun way to look at how even a dumb computer can be programmed to solve a fairly complex maze.

Since it's coded in BASIC, the source can be easily viewed by BREAKing into the program.

You will need an emulator to play this game. May I suggest my own emulator Zero to play this game: http://zero.arjunnair.in/download/

Or you can try various others, for various platforms, that can be found at: https://worldofspectrum.org/tools/emulators

Enjoy!
